lines.text: Right Banks, you bastard! I'm the daddy now, next time, I'll fucking kill ya!

[to Angel]
Hands by your sides! Attention! Name and number?
Straight out the banana trees, eh? Well, you take it from me, nig-nog, you go steal white man's motor cars and you get white man's stick, right?
Now, get this cell scrubbed. On the double!

[to Richards]
Slasher? 'ere look at this. "Its" had a nightmare.
There's more where that come from, Carlin. You just keep yer fucking mouth closed.
What happened to yer face, Carlin?
[Carlin tries to talk but Mr Sands interrupts him]
Quiet! Speak when I tell you! Somebody hit you, eh? Answer, somebody hit you.
We know about you, sunny. Who was it?
I fell sir. On the stairs. Wasn't used to the concrete steps. Me own fault.
I want none of yer tricks here, laddy. Understand that?
Any more of this and yer in trouble, real trouble! Understand?
Well move yerself, you little guttersnipe! Move!
Sometimes, someday I somehow get the strangest notion they're trying to break my spirit.
Keep it moving, there 's no sandcastles on Margate beach. Come on Archer, no slaggin' for you, you long streak of cabbage.
no punching in the face, no kicking in the goolies, and no biting.

[Carlin offers Archer a sausage]
No strings?
You might be a smart ass, Archer, but your nothing but a fool to yourself.
You can learn a lot in here if you use your loaf.

Cut that out, Davis, or I'll give you something to cry about, you mardy ass little toe-rag. You touch that bell again for no fucking reason, I'll have you down the block before your feet touch the ground. Now get your subnormal head down!

So this is 'The Daddy' - the 'ardcase. Carlin, is it? Don't look much to me, Carlin... you're the little toerag who thumped the officer at Rowley... fancy yerself do ya, Carlin? Thumpin' officers, eh?
Ok, Carlin. You're really for it this time. Banks and Richards have both named you. You get 3 years for this, scum.
I don't know what you're talking about, sir.
You fuckin' well know, toe-rag. I run this wing. I'm not letting it disrupted by a back-street villain like you. You'll sign a statement downstairs.
I've got nothin' to say. I'd like to see the House Master.
And the governor, sir. I've got a witness.

Shit witness. I'm having you lad. You banged that officer at Roly. You must have thought you walked quietly away from that one. But he's here. He's me. He's every fucking screw in this borstal. Every one of us. Come on!
Fancy taking a poke at me? Come on, big man.
I've banged no screw, I retaliated. There was two of 'em, kicking the shit out of me.

[grabs Richards]
Who was it, Richards? Who was it? Carlin? The coon?

[to everyone]
Right, on your feet! Who did this?
[Mr Sands finds Banks on the floor]

[grabs Banks and slams him against a wall]
Dozy bastard, Banks! You let him do you over, you twat!
Don't come at me! Who d'yer think yer talking to? Carlin! I want you to name Carlin!
I feel lonely, sir... I feel depressed, even.

[noticing Archer's bare feet]
You don't do yourself no favours, mate.
[Angel, Davis and Carlin are all lined up against a wall]
Right. I'm Mr. Sands, this is Mr Greaves. I'm the senior officer and I run A wing. I run it. Right, Carlin?
I come down very heavy on anyone who doesn't grasp that fact. Right? Right?
Angel, you're in a single room. Some of the lads are what you might call..."prejudiced". You're well advised to keep yourself to yourself. It's your first borstal, innit lad?
Yes, sir, apart from the Scrubs...

[interrupts Angel]
Forget the Scrubs! The holiday's over.
Davis, you were foolish enough to run away from an open borstal and you'll soon be wishing you were back there. You're in a single room. Now move!

[at Carlin]
Carlin, you're in a dormitory. Now, move!
That's it! In there, on the left.
[Carlin goes to the dormitory on the left and stops. Mr Sands walks in]

[points at an empty bed]
That's yours, Carlin.
You know the ropes and you know why you're here. I'll jump on you from a great height if you so much as breathe. Got that?
There's a lad, a big lad called Pongo in that bed. He heard you were coming. Now, grab that broom and get to work on that floor. I wanna shave in it!
[Carlin grabs the broom and scrubs the floor. As he scrubs the floor, Mr Sands deliberately drops Carlin's gear]
We don't leave our bed space in that condition in here. Make up your bed and your gear away. On the double!
[Carlin puts the broom away and unpacks his gear]
I never have been short of birds, plenty of crumpet after me.
The only crumpet you've had is with your fist.
[Davis stands up but Banks kicks him. Eckersley laughs]
Davis, yer nothing. I'm the Daddy 'ere, I run this wing. You pay yer dues like the rest. Payday, you deliver a quarter of your snout to Stripey 'ere, every week on the dot.

[slaps Davis]
You fuckin' well do now, slag! There's no dolly mixtures here, poofter! I'm the Daddy and don't you ever forget it, right?

[to Angel]
Stand up, coon. Name and number. Attention when I come in. I said up!

[grabs Angel]
He said up, didn't he?
[Banks and Richards beats up Angel and scatter his gear on the floor. Eckersley, Banks and Richards leave]
[Mr Sands discovers Angel's room is a mess shortly after Angel's beating]
What's this then? On your feet, lad! What do you think this is? Stand up! Name and number?
Can't remember? Your number, lad, that's all you are, a number! A number! Four digits. That's all you are! 4736! Name and number?
Don't give that, boy! Who did this?
Damaging government property are we, you black bastard?
Come on, what are we doing then, you black Brixton slag.
Fighting, you're booked for fighting. Governor's report, right?
[Banks wakes up Carlin and slaps him]
Right, Carlin. I run this fuckin' gaff and yer dead if you come any of it 'ere!
Leave off, will ya? I don't give a fuck who the Daddy is. I don't want trouble so just piss off and let me get on with me time, all right?
We'll give you time, ya bastard.
[Banks punches Carlins, jumps on his bed, headbutts him and continues to punch him]
[Carlin walks in to the lounge and takes three snooker balls from the snooker table and puts them in an extra sock. The two people playing snooker look confused]
[Carlin continues moving and stands at a corner. Richards is kicking Woods]

[to Richards]
Ah! Leave it out, Stripey! I ain't hurting you!
What's up with you, weirdo? You want stripin' do ya? You might get left alone 'ere, but I'll cut you to bleedin' ribbons if I get any of yer poxy lip 'ere!
[Carlin whacks Richards with the sock containing the snooker balls. Eckersley tries to report this to Mr Sands but Carlins orders him not to]
Back, grass! I said, get back, shit head.
[Eckersley backs off, Carlin kicks Richards and returns the snooker balls]
[Carlin slips bar out of his sleeve and hits Baldy with it]
Get over here and keep my seat warm.
Oh look at that all over my hair!
Quiet, Jackson, or do we want Mr. Teasy Weasy in there with ya?
Only washed it last night, Sir.
Quiet, you little poof and keep shoveling.
What are you supposed to be doing?
Than shovel it in the barrow, savvy. When we want it the other side of the Channel we'll let you know, lad.
Look at you sitting there with that daft smile on your face. Why aren't you over there with the rest of them?
What do you think that lot are, Disciples?

You know when I was in the Scrubs, sweating it out in that filthy cell, I had this matchbox. And it said on this matchbox that it takes 60 muscles to frown but only 13 to smile, so why waste energy? You see, I'm doing me time in a matchbox.
